issues.title: Clicking hidden radio/checkbox inputs via refs reports 'ok' status with a warnin
symptoms: Clicking hidden radio/checkbox inputs via refs reports 'ok' status with a warning about visibility, but does NOT actually toggle the input state. The click appears to succeed from the response but has no effect. This is misleading - either the click should actually work (e.g., by automatically clicking the associated label), or it should report a clearer failure indicating the input was not toggled. On demoqa.com, radio buttons and checkboxes use hidden inputs with visible CSS-styled labels, which is an extremely common pattern across modern web frameworks.

issues.title: TinyMCE editor on the-internet.herokuapp.com is permanently in read-only mode du
symptoms: TinyMCE editor on the-internet.herokuapp.com is permanently in read-only mode due to expired Tiny Cloud API key. The console shows 'All created TinyMCE editors are configured to be read-only' and 'you have no more editor loads available this month'. This means the test cannot be completed via normal user interaction (switchToFrame + fill/type). The only way to set content is via direct DOM manipulation through pageFunction, which bypasses the editor's read-only restriction. This test should either use a self-hosted TinyMCE instance without cloud licensing, or the test expectations should acknowledge that DOM manipulation is the expected approach.

issues.title: Snapshot returns empty YAML inside frameset frames
symptoms: After switching to frame-left (a frame inside a frameset), snapshot returned {yaml: '', refs: {}}. The accessibility tree may not properly traverse frameset-based frames. Had to use pageFunction as fallback to read text content.

issues.title: No native file upload support - had to use pageFunction with Dropzone API
symptoms: cdp-skill fill step rejects file inputs as 'not editable'. Had to use pageFunction to call Dropzone.forElement().addFile() to programmatically upload. CDP protocol supports DOM.setFileInputFiles which could be exposed as a dedicated step (e.g., 'uploadFile' or 'setFileInput') for native file upload support without requiring pageFunction workarounds.
issues.workaround: cdp-skill fill step rejects file inputs as 'not editable'. Had to use pageFunction to call Dropzone.forElement().addFile() to programmatically upload. CDP protocol supports DOM.setFileInputFiles which could be exposed as a dedicated step (e.g., 'uploadFile' or 'setFileInput') for native file upload support without requiring pageFunction workarounds.

symptoms: After the first drag attempt with mouse-events method (call 4), the viewportSnapshot still showed 'banner A' and 'banner B' even though visually the drag occurred. issues.title: getDom useful for understanding page mechanics
symptoms: Using getDom step to inspect the full page HTML revealed the JavaScript event handlers and HTML5 drag-and-drop implementation details. This helped identify that the page uses HTML5 DnD, not a custom drag library.
issues.workaround: Using getDom step to inspect the full page HTML revealed the JavaScript event handlers and HTML5 drag-and-drop implementation details. This helped identify that the page uses HTML5 DnD, not a custom drag library.

issues.title: buildVerifyCapture wraps eval_truthy expressions containing statements in !!() causing syntax errors
get step fails with 'Could not detect data type' for simple text extraction
symptoms: Both `{"get":"#finish h4"}` and `{"get":{"selector":"#finish h4","mode":"text"}}` fail with 'Could not detect data type. Use type: "table" or "list" option.' The error message suggests it's trying to auto-detect a data format when mode:'text' should simply extract textContent. The mode parameter appears to be completely ignored. This forces users to fall back to pageFunction for basic text extraction, which defeats the purpose of having a get step.
